question:
You and your family are living in rented accommodation in an English speaking country. You are not satisfied with the condition of some of the furniture.
Write a letter to your friend. In your letter
-introduce yourself
-explain what is wrong with the furniture
-say what action you would like the landlord to take
Write at least 150 words.
You do NOT need to write any addresses.
Begin your letter as follows:
Dear ................. ,
text: I am writing this letter to show my dissatisfaction with the furniture which is present at my rented residence.

I am one of your tenants, living at house number 04 on the sixth floor in the Supershine Building near the North-West side of Downtown. A month ago, I signed a lease with you for 24 months and you assure me that this apartment has great quality furniture and other modern facilities.

However, I would like to inform you that the quality of some items present in my flat is poor. Firstly, the bed in the living area is causing an irritating sound when I sleep on it. Secondly, the chair which is kept in the study room has gradually been ingested by termites. As a result of termites, it is likely to get broken. Finally, the table near the entrance has draws which are totally jammed. In short, there are a lot of problems with these furniture items.

I would like to request you to either replace these items or fix these issues by calling the carpenter. If it would not the case, I am afraid that I have to cancel the contract, but I do not want to take this action.
I hope you will resolve this issue as soon as possible.
